name: Introduction to Humanities
description: This course introduces students to the key concepts, theories, and methods of the humanities, including literature, culture, history, philosophy, and religion.

name: Foundations of Communication Studies
description: This course introduces students to the major theories and methods of communication studies, including verbal and nonverbal communication, media and technology, and analysis and criticism.

name: Interpersonal Communication
description: This course focuses on the role of communication in interpersonal relationships, examining communication in romantic, family, and professional relationships.

name: Organizational Communication
description: This course examines communication in organizational contexts, including within and between organizations, and explores communication theories and practices in the workplace.

name: Public Speaking
description: This course focuses on the principles of public speaking, including verbal and nonverbal communication, audience analysis, and speech preparation.

name: Research Methods in Communication Studies
description: This course focuses on the research methods used in communication studies, including qualitative and quantitative methods.
